item.title: Velvetink add a quote by John Pilger
item.description: "Orwell is almost our litmus test. Some of his satirical writing looks like reality these days." -- John Pilger

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Djuna Barnes
item.description: "We are adhering to life now with our last muscle - the heart." -- Djuna Barnes

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "The camera makes everyone a tourist in other people's reality, and eventually in one's own." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Antonia Fraser
item.description: "As long as you persecute people, you will actually throw up terrorism." -- Antonia Fraser

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Edward Steichen
item.description: "No photographer is as good as the simplest camera. " -- Edward Steichen

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Lewis Hine
item.description: "If I could tell the story in words, I wouldn't need to lug around a camera. " -- Lewis Hine

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Andre Dubus
item.description: "A story can always break into pieces while it sits inside a book on a shelf; and, decades after we have read it even twenty times, it can open us up, by cut or caress, to a new truth." -- Andre Dubus

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupery
item.description: "Sorrow is one of the vibrations that prove the fact of living." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupery

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "A quiet secluded life in the country, with the possibility of being useful to people to whom it is easy to do good, and who are not accustomed to have it done to them; then work which one hopes may be of some use; then rest, nature, books, music, love for one's neighbor — such is my idea of happiness." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I read," I say. "I study and read. I bet I've read everything you read. Don't think I haven't. I consume libraries. I wear out spines and ROM-drives. I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." My instincts concerning syntax and mechanics are better than your own, I can tell, with all due respect. But it transcends the mechanics. I'm not a machine. I feel and believe. I have opinions. Some of them are interesting. I could, if you'd let me, talk and talk." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Sven Hedin
item.description: "I was swept away by the irresistible desiderium incognitti which breaks down all obstacles and refuses to recognise the impossible" -- Sven Hedin

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Joris-Karl Huysmans
item.description: "Immersed in solitude, he would dream or read far into the night. By protracted contemplation of the same thoughts, his mind grew sharp, his vague, undeveloped ideas took on form." -- Joris-Karl Huysmans

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "<b>Résumé</b> Razors pain you, Rivers are damp, Acids stain you, And drugs cause cramp. Guns aren't lawful, Nooses give, Gas smells awful. You might as well live." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "A pain stabbed my heart, as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Flannery O' Connor
item.description: "Where you come from is gone, where you thought you were going to never was there, and where you are is no good unless you can get away from it" -- Flannery O' Connor

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The way to despair is to refuse to have any kind of experience." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Iggy Pop
item.description: "I have a hot memory, but I know I've forgotten many things, too, just squashed things in favor of survival." -- Iggy Pop

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Chaos is rejecting all you have learned, Chaos is being yourself." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Emil Cioran
item.description: "Between the demand to be clear,and the temptation to be obscure, impossible to decide which deserves more respect." -- Emil Cioran

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I've been making a list of the things they don't teach you at school. They don't teach you how to love somebody. They don't teach you how to be famous. They don't teach you how to be rich or how to be poor. They don't teach you how to walk away from someone you don't love any longer. They don't teach you how to know what's going on in someone else's mind. They don't teach you what to say to someone who's dying. They don't teach you anything worth knowing." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Sometimes we can choose the paths we follow. Sometimes our choices are made for us. And sometimes we have no choice at all." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "That which is dreamed can never be lost, can never be undreamed." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Velvetink add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath
